result.execSummary:
The defendant Peter S. Hemmy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Intentional Homicide [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class A felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.01(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Possibility of Extended Supervision after serving 40 years.  If any offenses in Prison, Eligibility date may be Extended. Deft must petition for release date no earlier than 60 days before Eligibility date.

Defendant Peter S. Hemmy in court in custody with attorney Jason Daane and Valerie A. Zisman.  Scott H. Dirks and Mason Braunschweig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sentence Recommendations Given; Court ORDERS:  Life Imprisonment; Possibility of Extended Supervision after serving 40 years. If any offenses in Prison, may extend eligibility date for Extended supervision.  Costs time served.  332 days credit.  Felony warnings Given.
